Title: BrightHR Lite Style Guide
User_Story: As a UI designer, I want a consistent style guide so that all interfaces maintain a professional and uniform appearance.
Functional_Requirements: Primary colors: Blue (#3B82F6), Neutral Gray (#6B7280), White (#FFFFFF); Typography: Sans-serif (Inter or system default); Spacing: Tailwind defaults with custom scale (4px increments); Buttons: Rounded-md, shadow-sm; Forms: Input borders gray-300, focus blue-500
Non_Functional_Requirements: Responsive design adherence; Accessibility: WCAG AA compliance (contrast ratios >4.5:1); Performance: Minimal CSS bloat via Tailwind purge
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. All wireframes use defined colors and typography; 2. Button styles match across components; 3. Responsive breakpoints (sm, md, lg) applied consistently; 4. No deviations in produced UIs
Vision_Ref: KEY FEATURES: All MVP elements require consistent UI
Notes: Base theme for all WF-xxx; Extendable for dark mode in future

Title: Employee Directory Search
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want to search the employee directory so that I can quickly find employee details.
Functional_Requirements: Search by name or email; Display results in table; Pagination if >10 results
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. User logs in; 2. Enters search term; 3. Results display accurately; 4. No results message if empty

Title: System Performance for Searches
User_Story: As a system administrator, I want the application to respond quickly to user searches so that the user experience remains efficient.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Search queries must return results in under 2 seconds; Support up to 50 concurrent users without degradation
Constraints: Local SQLite database; No external caching in MVP
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. Load test with 50 users shows <2s response; 2. Average search time measured in logs <1.5s; 3. No errors during peak simulation
Notes: Ensures scalability for small business use

Title: Local Mac Environment Setup
User_Story: As a developer, I want a simple local setup for the Mac so that I can run the app easily without external dependencies.
Functional_Requirements: Not specified
Non_Functional_Requirements: Platform: Mac local (Ventura+), web-based (localhost access only in MVP); Backend framework and version: Node.js v18+ with Express (handles API endpoints and serves static frontend files); Frontend approach: Plain HTML/CSS/JS served by Express from /public (NO React/Vue for MVP—keeps it lightweight and fast to develop); Database: SQLite via sqlite3 npm package (v5.1+) (file-based DB stored in the project directory, ./data.sqlite for production; :memory: for tests when NODE_ENV=test—no server setup required); Use sqlite3 package (NOT better-sqlite3); Callback-based API: db.run(), db.get(), db.all() with callback functions; Pattern: Wrap all database callbacks in Promises for async/await compatibility, e.g., new Promise((resolve, reject) => { db.run(sql, params, (err) => { if (err) reject(err); else resolve(); }); }); Server Port: Single port 3000 (backend and static frontend both served from http://localhost:3000 for simplicity); Test framework: Node.js native test runner (node --test) (NO Jest, Mocha, or other frameworks); Development: npm scripts in package.json: 'start': starts the Express server (backend + static files) on port 3000; 'test': NODE_ENV=test node --test (runs Node.js native tests with in-memory database); Full setup: `npm install` for dependencies (Node.js via Homebrew or nvm); use .env for config (e.g., PORT=3000, DB_PATH=./data.sqlite); Seeding: On first run, seed test data via backend script: 1 admin user (admin@test.com / Password123! hashed with bcrypt), 5 sample employee records; Code patterns: Use async/await for all async operations; try/catch for error handling in all endpoints; Cross-platform portability: relative paths only; minimal native modules; Mac-Specific Notes: Install Node.js (v18+) via Homebrew (`brew install node`); Ensure DB file writable; test on M1/M2 (arm64 compatible); Allow localhost:3000 in firewall if prompted; README.md with steps: '1. Install Node. 2. Clone repo. 3. npm install. 4. npm start. Access: http://localhost:3000.'; Testing: Smoke tests via Node.js native test runner (npm test executes `node --test`—no external frameworks like Jest for MVP); Portability & Gotchas: Relative paths only; minimal native modules for cross-platform ease; Gitignore .env and DB file for security; Budget constraints: Total pilot budget under $5K, focusing on local development to avoid hosting fees initially.
Integrations: Local SQLite DB; npm for dependencies
Constraints: Mac-compatible setup; Cross-platform portability; Budget under $5K; No external frameworks like Jest for MVP
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. npm install completes with dependencies; 2. npm start launches Express server on port 3000 with static files served; 3. Access http://localhost:3000 loads the app; 4. Database file ./data.sqlite is created and seeded with admin user and sample employees; 5. npm test runs Node.js native tests successfully with in-memory DB; 6. All async operations use async/await and try/catch; 7. Setup works on macOS Ventura+ without external services.
Vision_Ref: CONSTRAINTS: Local run on Mac, SQLite; TECHNICAL STACK
Notes: Enforces lightweight MVP; Aligns exactly with Vision technical stack; Foundational for all stories.

Title: Onboarding Checklist
User_Story: As an HR manager, I want an onboarding checklist for new hires so that I can track required steps and ensure smooth integration.
Functional_Requirements: BACKEND: GET/POST /api/onboarding/:employeeId endpoints for checklist items (e.g., document submission, training completion); Database schema for checklists linked to employees; Mark items as complete with timestamps. FRONTEND: Checklist page with employee selector, list of steps (e.g., 'Submit contract', 'Complete training'), checkboxes for completion, progress bar; Role-based (HR view all, employee view own). TEST DATA: Seed 3 sample onboarding checklists with steps for testing.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Response time <2s; Secure access (login required); GDPR compliant (employee data access controls)
Integrations: Database for employee and checklist data
Constraints: MVP: Local simulation of notifications for completions
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. HR creates/adds checklist for new employee; 2. Steps display with completion status; 3. Mark complete updates DB and shows progress; 4. Employee can view own checklist; 5. Unauthorized access blocked
Vision_Ref: Nice-to-Haves: Onboarding checklist for new hires (step-by-step guides and task tracking)
Notes: Enhances new hire process; Suggest creating WF-012 for UI if needed

Title: Email Notifications for Leave Approvals
User_Story: As an HR manager and employee, I want email notifications for leave approvals and key updates so that I stay informed without logging in constantly.
Functional_Requirements: BACKEND: On approval (from US-005), trigger simulated email (log to console/file in MVP); POST /api/notifications for sending; Templates for approval/rejection. FRONTEND: Notification preferences page (opt-in for types); Success message after approval showing 'email sent'. MVP: Simulate with logs, prepare for real email (nodemailer) later. TEST DATA: Use seeded admin and employee for simulation.
Non_Functional_Requirements: Secure (no sensitive data in emails); Delivery simulation <1s; GDPR (consent for notifications)
Integrations: Email simulation via console/logs; Future: nodemailer
Constraints: MVP: No real email sending; Local simulation only
Acceptance_Criteria: 1. On leave approval, simulation logs 'email sent' to employee; 2. HR sees confirmation; 3. Employee can toggle notifications; 4. No real emails sent in MVP; 5. Logs verifiable in tests
